intro: Gouania acalyphoides, commonly known as the arrowleaf gouania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
